title: Understanding Data Storage
text: In databases, data is organized in a structured way. Understanding the basic components of a database can help you determine where specific types of data are stored.

title: What is a Column?
text: A column in a database table is a set of data values of a particular type, one for each row of the table. It is often used to store a specific attribute of the data.

title: What is a Row?
text: A row in a database table represents a single, implicitly structured data item in a table. It is often used to store a record of data.

title: What is a Schema?
text: A schema is the structure that defines the organization of data in a database. It includes the tables, columns, and relationships between them.

title: What is a Table?
text: A table in a database is a collection of related data held in a structured format within a database. It consists of rows and columns.

title: Identifying the Correct Storage
text: Given that Bryan, Lisa, and Mike's ages are specific attributes, where would these attributes most likely be stored in a database?
